      • discoverShapeTree

        public Optional<ShapeTreeManager> discoverShapeTree​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                                    URL targetResource)
                                             throws ShapeTreeException
        Discover the ShapeTreeManager associated with a given target resource. Implements ShapeTreeClient.discoverShapeTree(com.janeirodigital.shapetrees.core.ShapeTreeContext, java.net.URL) Shape Trees, ยง4.1: This operation is used by a client-side agent to discover any shape trees associated with a given resource. If URL is a managed resource, the associated Shape Tree Manager will be returned. https://shapetrees.org/TR/specification/#discover
        Specified by:
        discoverShapeTree in interface ShapeTreeClient
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - The URL of the target resource for shape tree discovery
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException

      • plantShapeTree

        public DocumentResponse plantShapeTree​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                       URL targetResource,
                                       URL targetShapeTree,
                                       URL focusNode)
                                throws ShapeTreeException
        Shape Trees, ยง4.2: This operation marks an existing resource as being managed by one or more shape trees, by associating a shape tree manager with the resource, and turning it into a managed resource. If the resource is already managed, the associated shape tree manager will be updated with another shape tree assignment for the planted shape tree. If the resource is a container that already contains existing resources, and a recursive plant is requested, this operation will perform a depth first traversal through the containment hierarchy, validating and assigning as it works its way back up to the target root resource of this operation. https://shapetrees.org/TR/specification/#plant-shapetree
        Specified by:
        plantShapeTree in interface ShapeTreeClient
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - The URL of the resource to plant on
        targetShapeTree - A URL representing the shape tree to plant for targetResource
        focusNode - An optional URL representing the target subject within targetResource used for shape validation
        Returns:
        The URL of the Shape Tree Manager that was planted for targetResource
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException

      • postManagedInstance

        public DocumentResponse postManagedInstance​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                            URL parentContainer,
                                            List<URL> focusNodes,
                                            List<URL> targetShapeTrees,
                                            String proposedResourceName,
                                            Boolean isContainer,
                                            String bodyString,
                                            String contentType)
                                     throws ShapeTreeException
        Description copied from interface: ShapeTreeClient
        Creates a resource via HTTP POST that has been validated against the provided shape tree
        Specified by:
        postManagedInstance in interface ShapeTreeClient
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        parentContainer - The container the created resource should be created within
        focusNodes - One or more nodes/subjects to use as the focus for shape validation
        targetShapeTrees - One or more target shape trees the resource should be validated by
        proposedResourceName - Proposed resource name (aka Slug) for the resulting resource
        isContainer - Specifies whether the newly created resource should be created as a container or not
        bodyString - String representation of body of the created resource
        contentType - Content type to parse the bodyString parameter as
        Returns:
        DocumentResponse containing status and response headers/attributes
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException - ShapeTreeException

        Parameters:

        resourceUrl - The target resource to be created or updated
        focusNodes - One or more nodes/subjects to use as the focus for shape validation
        targetShapeTrees - The shape trees that a proposed resource to be created should be validated against
        isContainer - Specifies whether a newly created resource should be created as a container or not
        bodyString - String representation of the body of the resource to create or update

      • unplantShapeTree

        public DocumentResponse unplantShapeTree​(ShapeTreeContext context,
                                         URL targetResource,
                                         URL targetShapeTree)
                                  throws ShapeTreeException
        Description copied from interface: ShapeTreeClient
        Shape Trees, ยง4.3: This operation unassigns a planted root shape tree from a root shape tree instance. If the root shape tree instance is a managed container, it will also unassign contained resources. If there are no remaining shape trees managing the resource, it would no longer be considered as managed. https://shapetrees.org/TR/specification/#unplant-shapetree
        Specified by:
        unplantShapeTree in interface ShapeTreeClient
        Parameters:
        context - ShapeTreeContext that would be used for authentication purposes
        targetResource - URL of target resource to unplant shape tree from
        targetShapeTree - URL of shape tree being unplanted
        Throws:
        ShapeTreeException
